snippet: William Howard Taft, the United States’ heaviest president, used a weight-loss program that researchers have found to be startlingly contemporary.
abstract: William Howard Taft, United States' heaviest president, struggled mightily to control his weight a century ago, but new research finds that his weight-loss program was startlingly contemporary, and his difficulties keeping the pounds off would be familiar to many Americans today.
lead_paragraph: William Howard Taft, the United States’ heaviest president, used a weight-loss program that researchers have found to be startlingly contemporary.

headline.main: In Struggle With Weight, Taft Used a Modern Diet
headline.print_headline: In Struggle With Weight a Century Ago, a Diet From Today
